title: ISIS fanatic stabs Indonesia's chief security minister
text:
Indonesia's chief security minister was stabbed by an ISIS radical as he stepped out of a vehicle near a university on Thursday.

Television footage showed security officers restraining a man and a woman after the attack on Wiranto, 72, in Pandeglang, Banten province, on the island of Java.

National Police spokesman Dedi Prasetyo confirmed both suspects - identified as Syahril Alamsyah, 31, and Fitri Andriana, 21 - have been arrested.

Both are said to belong to ISIS-linked terror network Jamaah Ansharut Daulah.

Indonesia's chief security minister Wiranto is carried on a stretcher to a waiting helicopter after he was stabbed twice in the stomach on Thursday

Wiranto had been visiting a university in Pandeglang, Banten province on the island of Java

'We have been able to identify the perpetrators as JAD members', intelligence chief Budi Gunawan said.

Wiranto suffered 'two deep wounds' to his stomach in the attack and may need surgery, but Berkah Hospital spokesman Firmansyah confirmed he was conscious and in a stable condition.

A local police chief, an army officer and an assistant also suffered non-life threatening injuries in the attack.

Wiranto was seen being carried on a stretcher to a helicopter before he was airlifted to the capital Jakarta following the incident on Thursday.

The former military general (pictured in September) suffered two stab wounds but was said to be in a stable condition

Police confirmed two suspects - identified as Syahril Alamsyah, 31, and Fitri Andriana, 21 - had been arrested

Alamsyah and Andriana, who are believed to be a couple, were carrying knives and a pair of scissors at the time of their arrest, ABC reported.

Wiranto had been visiting the university to open a new building, where dozens had gathered to shake hands and take photographs with the minister.

The attack comes just over a week before Indonesian President Joko Widodo kicks off a second term after his April re-election.

In May, police said Wiranto and three other top officials were targeted in a failed assassination plot linked to deadly riots in Jakarta after Widodo's victory.

Wiranto was airlifted to the capital Jakarta following the incident on Thursday

A group of six people - arrested before they could carry out the killings - planned to murder the officials and an election pollster in a bid to plunge the country into chaos, police said at the time.

Wiranto, the former chief of the armed forces and a failed presidential candidate, is a major figure in Indonesian politics.

He has long been accused of human-rights violations and for crimes against humanity linked to violence following East Timor's 1999 independence referendum.
description: Indonesia's chief security minister Wiranto was attacked by an IS radical on Thursday when he stepped out of a vehicle near a university in Pandeglang, Banten province.
